page.title: 10FORTON WAR MEMORIAL
page.content: The War Memorial stands next to the A6 at the end of School Lane.It stands on a step, it has a cross at the top and a crown in the middle.It is about 3 metres tall. In 1984 the war memorial got knocked down. This is a new one.The church puts a wreath on the step on Remembrance Sunday so does the St Johns ambulance.A lot of other people put flowers down as well. Two minutes silence is observed. The words on the war memorial are: To the honoured memory of the men of Forton and district who fell in the Great War of 1914 till 1918: Henry Rimmer,John Crane,Tom Wright, John Bowman,Richard Alston,Richard Newton,Henry Hoole,Julian Hughes, Eric Spooner,James Armer,Stephen Donnelly,John Willcocks,Peter Hulland, Robert Brockbank,William Kay.
